intro: Cordylocarpus glaber, commonly known as the smooth cordylocarpus, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the daisies family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its upright, grass-like appearance with narrow, strap-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in dense heads, often appearing in late spring to early summer. It thrives in coastal and subcoastal environments, preferring well-drained soils and full sun. Cordylocarpus glaber is often used in native landscaping due to its hardy nature and ornamental value.
